reviews.title: Best of 'Bali and Beyond'.
reviews.text: A lot of good reviews for this site, I am happy to endorse the many positive comments about the hotel.

reviews.title: Almost perfect.....apart from the food.
reviews.text: The unique thing about Aman resorts is that they fit in with you. If you want to have breakfast at 1pm, no problem. And the breakfast here is amongst the best I have ever had.

reviews.title: Amazing....
reviews.text: There is one comment in another review about the food. I enjoyed the food here but I understand the comment. I feel the Chef is limited a little by choice of ingredients in quite a remote location, not skill. This is rural Java not central London, and that is part of the attraction. If you want to go 'off menu' you only have to ask.

reviews.title: The most beautiful hotel I have ever seen
reviews.text: We took quite a few trips out. Didit, our guide was excellent, pitching his tour at exactly the right level on every occasion. The tour of a market in a nearby town was particularly memorable.

reviews.title: Aman still the best!
reviews.text: We took the 'Bali and Beyond' package also visiting Amanusa and Amandari. This hotel, mainly because of the location, was the highlight of the three.
Perfect. Enough said. But I am told reviews need to be 50 characters. Really -best place we have ever stayed. Bar none.
reviews.title: A faultless paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second visit at Amanjiwo and second memorable and unparalleled experience. It's even hard to find a word strong enough for the level of pleasure and satisfaction we have had during these few days we spent in this unique property.
reviews.title: OUT OF THIS WORLD... The most amazing resort on earth.

reviews.text: From the moment you land until the moment you'll hardly leave, Amanjiwo will exceed your highest expectations and you'll be superbly pampered by a family, not by hotel employees. Each person who is working at Amanjiwo will never stop to search how to make you the most happy person, will try to make you special at all times and that's absolutely impressive and so not often happening.
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings, absolutely fantastic service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel in itself is a pure wonder of architecture. Designed by Ed Turtle, this very exclusive property is like a little Borobudur, elegant, peaceful, so relaxing and perfectly maintained. The surrounding area is just gorgeous and everywhere your eyes will stop, be prepared to a strong emotion. The view across the rural and superb Javanese countryside on the biggest Bouddhist temple of Borobudur is simply breathtaking.
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.text: After a welcome so marvellous with little javanese girls throwing fragant flowers petals on us, we have been escorted by the duty manager, Francisco, and our butler to the incredible Dalem Jiwo suite, a discreet compound where we stayed already last time. But even after one stay in which is undoubtly the most beautiful suite on our planet, we jumped into a dream when we see this open air living room under a rotunda facing a long 15 meters pool like floating up the the rice fields and regarding the majestic Borobudur and all around the vulcanoes.
reviews.title: Great Location and attentive service

reviews.text: Like many people, I scour Tripadvisor reviews when choosing hotels, restaurants and things to do - and no matter how consistently highly rated a particular place is, there are always naysayers. This is as true for Amanjiwo as it for everywhere else, but I have to say in this case that the yays have it...
reviews.title: There is no better experience!

reviews.text: For a start, there is simply no location like this anywhere else. Amanjiwo is simply a stunningly beautiful property. In addition to poetic views of Borobudur and the surrounding valley, it possesses a life affirming aura which is impossible to describe here. The age induced 'fatigue' that other reviewers mention is not obvious, and where one does notice a crack here or a blemish there, this is all congruent with the graceful aging of a grand temple, just like the more famous one down the road.
reviews.title: Majectically Amazing.......I'm in Awe

reviews.text: Some specifics - the service is intimate, genuine, and in my opinion unrivaled; and the food is spectacular, especially the Indonesian 'Makan Malam' traditional dinners. One night we opted instead for an in-suite Indonesian BBQ with private chef, and this was without doubt one of the finest dining experiences in our well-travelled lives.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.text: We also enjoyed the afternoon Borobudur 'Intellectual Tour', which was so good and comprehensive that we elected not to do the much-hyped (and outrageously expensive) Borobudor Sunrise. We may have missed a soulful sunrise but didn't feel that we missed any of the experience.
reviews.title: Near perfect hotel

reviews.text: I highly recommend the Menoreh Hills trek - this was an unexpectedly intimate and rich activity that was really undersold in the reviews here and at the hotel. If you love a bit of exercise, great views and a real taste of Indonesian village life then this is for you.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: Excellent location, service superb. Quality of kitchen outstanding, well organized and a very warm home.
reviews.title: Aman all over !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sunrise tour is loosing its sharm as busses from Yogya arrive early and Amanjiwo does not have exclusive access anymore. Just go when you want, fantastic experience.
reviews.title: Paradise found

reviews.text: Amanjiwo is truly a magical place, set below the Menoreh Hills and with stunning views of rice fields and Borobudur temple. The hotel design takes inspiration in the main features of the temple. Suites are amazing, most of them with great wiews of Borobudur temple from your own balé. The staff is fantastic and since the moment you arrive at the airport they make sure you have an incredible time at Amanjiwo. We booked the 3 night cultural trail pack which included 3 activities, we enjoyed all of them specially Sunrise Borobudur Tour, there are a great variety of activities to choose from and is definitely good value. We are still in love with Amanjiwo... it does not come cheap but it is an inspiring and unique experience.
reviews.title: Top Notch Resort in Java Island near Borobodur Temple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once awhile in life you ought to splur on your vacation. When you have that oppotunity try to stay in AMANJIWO. This the top notch resort in Java island. Great service and clean. Fantastic view of the Borobodur temple from the restaurant. Even if you don't stay here, you might be able to have breakfast or brunch here. Again, it is very pricey but worth it!
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing but with Caution!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every review of this place speaks to the amazing service, beauty, grandeur and quality you will find here. All of it is true. This is surely one of the most spectacular properties you will ever stay at. We had booked a Garden Suite but were upgraded upon arrival to the Garden Pool Suite with a view of Borobudur in the distance. Our private pool and cabana were a highlight of our trip throughout Thailand and Indonesia. We also had a deep marble tub for two in our private garden! You cannot imagine the quality of everything in this hotel. From the moment we were met on the tarmac, escorted to a VIP lounge and served pastries and cappuccino while someone from the hotel waited for our baggage and tagged it with leather luggage tags, we were treated like very important guests. After check-in we were escorted to our room and our luggage was already placed in separate dressing areas for him and her with the appropriate small sized slippers, make-up mirror and robe for her! There are even straw hats and bags for your use that you can take home as a souvenir. Now for the caution...the price! A small 6 oz.glass of a non-alcoholic ginger beer was approximately $15 US and most of that was ice! Their signature soursop martini was approximately $30, for one! A glass of orange juice is about $10. The dawn tour of Borobudur for two will cost about $200. If cost is not an issue then by all means book the tours, order in room service, go to the spa. But this property is not near anything so it's not like you have a choice unless you want to take a car and go into the small town ( but that car ride will cost about $35 an hour) and try your luck with the local cuisine.
reviews.title: Perhaps The Best Hotel In The World
